original_content:
Hi!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~The measure of a person is not how great his faith is
BUT how great his love is...(I Cor. 13:13)

Our Bible Verse for Today:

If anyone is hungry he should eat at home, so that when you meet together
it may not result in judgment. And when I come I will give further directions.
(I Cor. 11:34) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

We should come to the Lord's Table desiring to fellowship
with other believers and come in an attitude of faith that we
are receiving the true body and blood of our Lord Jesus Christ. 

We should always partake of the Lord's Supper in the right 
frame of mind...

We should never, ever, come to the Lord's Supper with a
grudge against someone...

If we don't forgive how can we expect God to forgive us???

When we pray the Lord's prayer, don't we pray, "Forgive us
our trespasses as we forgive those who trespass against us."

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, refresh my memory of any sin or thought
I hold against another person...Cleanse me of all unrighteousness. Amen.

Keep looking up, He is our sustainer/provider...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: We should come to the Lord's Table desiring to fellowship with other believers and come in an attitude of faith that we are receiving the true body and blood of our Lord Jesus Christ. We should always partake of the Lord's Supper in the right frame of mind. We should never, ever, come to the Lord's Supper with a grudge against someone. If we don't forgive how can we expect God to forgive us??? When we pray the Lord's prayer, don't we pray, "Forgive us our trespasses as we forgive those who trespass against us."
original_verse_text: If anyone is hungry he should eat at home, so that when you meet together it may not result in judgment. And when I come I will give further directions.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, seeking to fellowship with one another at Your table. Help us to partake of the Lord's Supper with faith, humility, and a spirit of forgiveness. May we never approach this sacred meal with grudges or unforgiveness in our hearts, for how can we expect Your forgiveness if we do not first forgive those who have wronged us? Lord, grant us the grace to live in harmony with one another, as Your Word instructs. Amen.
reflection: We should come to the Lord's Table desiring to fellowship with other believers and come in an attitude of faith that we are receiving the true body and blood of our Lord Jesus Christ. We should always partake of the Lord's Supper in the right frame of mind. We should never, ever, come to the Lord's Supper with a grudge against someone. If we don't forgive, how can we expect God to forgive us? When we pray the Lord's Prayer, don't we pray, “Forgive us our trespasses as we forgive those who trespass against us.”
subject: Partake the Lord's Supper with Forgiveness
verse_text: If anyone is hungry he should eat at home, so that when you meet together it may not result in judgment. And when I come I will give further directions.

original_content:
Hi!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Real friends are those who, when you've made a fool
of yourself, don't feel you've done a permanent job. (I Cor. 13:7, 8)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Now about spiritual gifts, brothers, I do not want you to be ignorant.

You know that when you were pagans, somehow or another you were 
influenced and led astray to mute idols...

Therefore I tell you that no one who is speaking by the Spirit of God 
says, "Jesus be cursed," and no one can say, "Jesus is Lord," except
by the Holy Spirit...(I Cor. 12:1-3) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

It is a reality that anyone can claim to speak for God, and the world is
full of false teachers...

Paul gives us a test to help us discern whether or not a message is 
really from God:

Does he or she confess Christ as Lord?
Don't naively accept the words of all who claim to speak for God.
Test their credentials by finding out what they teach about Christ...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for wisdom to discern
the teaching of others so that I and others would not 
be led astray, by false teaching. Help me to be sensitive
to Your Holy Spirit's teaching...Amen.

Keep looking up, for discernment...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Test their credentials by finding out what they teach about Christ.

In a world filled with false teachers and deceptive voices, we ask that You guide us to recognize the truth. Help us to test the spirits, as Your Word instructs, and to hold fast to the confession that Jesus Christ is Lord. May our hearts be steadfast in the truth of Your Son, the true Messiah, and may we not be led astray by those who would deny His divinity. Grant us the courage to stand firm in our faith, that we may honor You in all we say and do. Amen.

original_content:
Hi!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Be careful that your marriage doesn't become
a duel instead of a duet...(Ro. 14:19).

Our Bible Verses for Today:

To each one the manifestation of the Spirit is given for 
the common good...

to one there is given through the Spirit the message of 
wisdom, to another the message of knowledge by means
of the same Spirit...

to another faith by the same Spirit, to another gifts of healing
by that one Spirit...(( Cor. 17:7-9) NIV.

Our Lesson for Today:

No matter what gifts we have been given they all have 
come from the Holy Spirit...

We are responsible to use and sharpen our gifts, but
we can take no credit for what God has freely given...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would become more
responsible for the gifts you have given. Forgive me for 
not always using my gifts as You would have me to do...Amen.

Keep looking up, He has a work for you to do...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the diverse gifts You have bestowed upon us through the power of Your Holy Spirit. Help us to recognize and humbly steward the unique talents and abilities You have graciously entrusted to each of us. May we use these gifts to serve one another and bring glory to Your name, not seeking our own praise but rather desiring to faithfully fulfill the purposes You have for our lives. In Jesus' name, Amen.

original_content:
Hi!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Sorry yesterdays devotion was not I Cor. 17:7-9
It was I Cor. 12:7-9)...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

The body is a unit, though it is made up of many parts; 
and though all its parts are many, they form on body.
So it is with Christ...(I Cor. 12:12) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul compares the body of Christ with a human body.
Each part as a specific function that is necessary to
the body as a whole...

The parts are different for a purpose, and in their difference
they must work together. Christians have to avoid two common
errors:

(1) Being proud of their abilities, ~ or
(2) Thinking they have nothing to give
to the body of believers...

Instead of comparing ourselves to one another, we should use
our different gifts, together, to spread the Good News of salvation.

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to never doubt my usefulness.
I know I was created for a purpose, so use me as You choose...Amen.

Keep looking up, He will make His wishes known...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

The parts are different for a purpose, and in their difference they must work together. Christians have to avoid two common errors: (1) Being proud of their abilities, ~ or (2) Thinking they have nothing to give to the body of believers. Instead of comparing ourselves to one another, we should use our different gifts, together, to spread the Good News of salvation.
original_verse_text: The body is a unit, though it is made up of many parts; and though all its parts are many, they form on body. So it is with Christ.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the unity we share in the body of Christ. Help us to recognize the unique gifts and talents You have bestowed upon each of us, and to use them in service to one another and for the advancement of Your kingdom. May we avoid the temptations of pride or self-deprecation, and instead humbly offer our diverse abilities to work together for Your glory. Guide us to use our differences to complement one another, that we may be a strong and effective witness to the world. In Jesus' name, Amen.

original_content:
Hi!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~The secret of achievement is to not let what you're
doing get to you before you get to it...(Pro. 16:3)

Our Bible Verse for Today:

For we are all baptized by one Spirit into one body whether
Jew or Greek, slave or free ~ and we were all given the one
Spirit to drink...(I Cor 12:13) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

We need to remember that the church is composed of many
types of people from a variety of backgrounds with a multitude
of gifts and abilities...

It is easy for these differences to divide people as was the 
case in Corinth. BUT despite the differences, all believers
have one thing in common ~ faith in Christ...

On this essential truth the church can find unity. All believers
are baptized by the one Holy Spirit into one body of believers,
the church...

We don't lose our individual identities, but we have an overriding
oneness in Christ. When we become a Christian the Holy Spirit 
takes up residence in us, and we are born into God's family.

"We have all received the same Spirit" means that we have all 
received the same Holy Spirit...As members of God's family,
we may have different interests and gifts, but we are united by
the Spirit into one spiritual body...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for making me a part
of Your family. I pray for a greater unity between the believers
of Your church...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is seeking unity in the body, the church
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: We need to remember that the church is composed of many types of people from a variety of backgrounds with a multitude of gifts and abilities. It is easy for these differences to divide people as was the case in Corinth. BUT despite the differences, all believers have one thing in common ~ faith in Christ. On this essential truth the church can find unity. All believers are baptized by the one Holy Spirit into one body of believers, the church. We don't lose our individual identities, but we have an overriding oneness in Christ. When we become a Christian the Holy Spirit takes up residence in us, and we are born into God's family."We have all received the same Spirit" means that we have all received the same Holy Spirit. As members of God's family, we may have different interests and gifts, but we are united by the Spirit into one spiritual body.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the unity we have in Christ, despite our many differences. Help us to remember that we are all one body, baptized by the same Holy Spirit, and united in our faith in You. May we celebrate our diversity of gifts and abilities and use them to build up Your church. Guide us to find common ground in Your love and to live in harmony as Your beloved children. Amen.
reflection: We need to remember that the church is composed of many types of people from a variety of backgrounds with a multitude of gifts and abilities. It is easy for these differences to divide people, as was the case in Corinth. But despite the differences, all believers have one thing in common—faith in Christ. On this essential truth, the church can find unity. All believers are baptized by the one Holy Spirit into one body of believers, the church. We don't lose our individual identities, but we have an overriding oneness in Christ. When we become a Christian, the Holy Spirit takes up residence in us, and we are born into God's family. “We have all received the same Spirit” means that we have all received the same Holy Spirit. As members of God's family, we may have different interests and gifts, but we are united by the Spirit into one spiritual body.

original_content:
Wop-pee its Saturday!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Most people wish to serve God ~ BUT
only in an advisory capacity...(I Pet. 5:6)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Please read these verses before going any farther
(I Cor. 12:14-24) ~ don't cheat!



Our Lesson for Today:

Using the analogy of the body, Paul emphasizes the importance of
each church member...

If a seemingly insignificant part is taken away, the whole body becomes
less effective. BUT thinking your gift is more important than someone
else's IS an expression of spiritual pride...

We should not look down on those who seem unimportant, and we
should not be jealous of others who have more visible gifts...

Instead, we should use the gifts we have been given and encourage
others to use theirs. If we don't, the body of believers will be less
effective...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to see how to better use the gifts 
You have given me. Help me be a better encourager to those who
have not found their place in the body of believers...Amen.

Keep looking up, He answers prayer...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Using the analogy of the body, Paul emphasizes the importance of each church member. If a seemingly insignificant part is taken away, the whole body becomes less effective. BUT thinking your gift is more important than someone else's IS an expression of spiritual pride. We should not look down on those who seem unimportant, and we should not be jealous of others who have more visible gifts. Instead, we should use the gifts we have been given and encourage others to use theirs. If we don't, the body of believers will be less effective.
original_verse_text: 14 Even so the body is not made up of one part but of many. 15 Now if the foot should say, “Because I am not a hand, I do not belong to the body,” it would not for that reason stop being part of the body. 16 And if the ear should say, “Because I am not an eye, I do not belong to the body,” it would not for that reason stop being part of the body. 17 If the whole body were an eye, where would the sense of hearing be? If the whole body were an ear, where would the sense of smell be? 18 But in fact God has placed the parts in the body, every one of them, just as he wanted them to be. 19 If they were all one part, where would the body be? 20 As it is, there are many parts, but one body. 21 The eye cannot say to the hand, “I don’t need you!” And the head cannot say to the feet, “I don’t need you!” 22 On the contrary, those parts of the body that seem to be weaker are indispensable, 23 and the parts that we think are less honorable we treat with special honor. And the parts that are unpresentable are treated with special modesty, 24 while our presentable parts need no special treatment.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the diverse gifts You have bestowed upon Your church. Help us to embrace the unique role each member plays, understanding that no part is insignificant. May we not be consumed by spiritual pride or jealousy, but rather use our gifts to build up the body and encourage one another. Guide us to work together in unity, that Your church may be effective in fulfilling Your purposes. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Using the analogy of the body, Paul emphasizes the importance of each church member. If a seemingly insignificant part is taken away, the whole body becomes less effective. But thinking your gift is more important than someone else's is an expression of spiritual pride. We should not look down on those who seem unimportant, and we should not be jealous of others who have more visible gifts. Instead, we should use the gifts we have been given and encourage others to use theirs. If we don't, the body of believers will be less effective.
subject: The Body's Vital Parts: Valuing Each One

original_content:
Hi!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Conscience is God's built-in warning system. Be very happy 
when it hurts you. Be very worried when it doesn't.

Our Bible verses for Today:

There should be no divisions in the body, but that its parts should
have equal concern for each other...

If one part suffers, every part suffers with it; if one part is honored,
every part rejoices with it...(I Cor. 12:25 26) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Its time for an honest assessment of ourselves...

What is your response when a fellow Christian is honored?
How do you respond when someone is suffer?

Scriptures tell us we are to be happy with those who are happy,
and if they are sad, share their sorrow (Ro. 12:15).

Too often, unfortunately, we are jealous of those who rejoice
and apathetic to those who weep ~ As believers we are in the 
world together ~ there is no such thing as private or individualistic
Christianity...

We need to get involved in the lives of others and not just enjoy
our own relationship with God...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father remove from me all forms of envy.
Help me to be thankful for all that I have ~ and rejoice with
those who seemingly have more. Help me to prepare myself
for your loving purpose...Amen.

Keep looking up, He has a purpose for your life...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Too often, unfortunately, we are jealous of those who rejoice and apathetic to those who weep ~ As believers we are in the world together ~ there is no such thing as private or individualistic Christianity. We need to get involved in the lives of others and not just enjoy our own relationship with God.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging our tendency to be self-centered and indifferent to the joys and sorrows of our brothers and sisters in Christ. Forgive us for the times we have been jealous of those who are honored and apathetic towards those who suffer. Help us to truly rejoice with those who rejoice and weep with those who weep, for we are all members of one body in You. May we be a people who are deeply invested in the lives of others, sharing in their triumphs and trials, and reflecting Your love and compassion to a world in need. In Your Son's name we pray, Amen.

We need to get involved in the lives of others and not just enjoy our own relationship with God.

Tue. 11th!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~So many forget God all day and 
ask Him to remember them at night...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Are all apostle? Are all prophet? are all teachers? Do all work miracles? 

Do all have gifts of healing? Do all speak in tongues? Do all interpret? 

But eagerly desire the greater gifts...(I Cor. 12:29-31) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

The most helpful gifts are those that are beneficial to the body of 
Christ. Paul has already made it clear that one gift is not superior
to another, but he urges the believers to discover how they can
serve Christ's body with the gifts God has given them...

Your spiritual gifts are not for your own self-advancement. They 
were given to you for serving God and enhancing the spiritual
growth of the body of believers...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me Lord to make myself
available to You and the body of believers. Help me
Lord to see how best to serve...Amen.

Keep looking up, He has the answers...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

May our spiritual gifts be a reflection of Your love and grace, not for our own gain, but for the edification of the church. In Jesus' name, Amen.

original_content:
Wed. 12th~~~(food for thought)~~If you don't stand for something
you'll fall for anything...(Isa. 7:9b) NIV

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast,
it is not proud...

It is not rude, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps
no record of wrongs...

Love does not delight in evil but rejoices with the truth...

It always protects, always trusts, always hopes, always persevers...
(I Cor. 13:4-7) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

To often today our society confuses love with lust. Unlike lust God's 
kind of love is directed outward toward others, not inward toward
ourselves...

It is utterly unselfish. This kind of love goes against our natural inclinations.
It is impossible to have this love unless God helps us set aside our own
natural desires so that we can love and not expect anything in return...

The more we become like Christ, the more love we will show to others...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, help me to set aside my sinful desires.
Help me to be more loving. Help me to be more sensitive and 
obedient to Your Spirit's leading and guiding...Amen.

Keep looking up, follow His leading...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

It always protects, always trusts, always hopes, always perseveres.

Help us to set aside our own selfish desires and embrace the unselfish love that You have shown us through Your Son, Jesus Christ. May our love for one another be genuine, patient, and kind, not seeking our own interests but the good of those around us. Transform our hearts, Lord, that we may reflect Your love to a world in need. In Your holy name, we pray. Amen.

original_content:
Thur, 3/13/08~~~(food for thought)~~~The measure of a person's character is not what he gets from his 
ancestors, but what he leaves his descendents. Pro. 13:22

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Again, if the trumpet does not sound a clear call, who will get
ready for battle?

So it is with you. Unless you speak intelligible words with your
tongue, how will anyone know what you are saying? You will
just be speaking into the air...

Undoubtedly there are all sorts of languages in the world, yet 
none of them is without meaning...(I Cor. 14:8-10) NIV


Our Lesson for Today:

What are you using your God given gifts for???

God gives us spiritual gifts in order to build up, serve,
and strengthen fellow Christians ~ the church...

In eternity we will be made perfect and complete and will
be in the very presence of God. We will no longer need
spiritual gifts, so they will come to an end...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would forgive me for
not always using the gifts You have give to build, serve, 
and strengthen the body of believers. I thank You for those
who have ministered to me in my moments of weakness...Amen.

Keep looking up, He will show you the way...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

few people are able to hold it...(Jm.3:5)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Anyone who speaks in a tongue should pray that he may interpret 
what he says...

For if I pray in a tongue, my spirit prays, but my mind is unfruitful...

So what shall I do? I will pray with my spirit, but I will also pray
with my mind; I will sing with my spirit, but I will also sing with my
mind...(I Cor. 14:13-15) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

What Paul is saying is there is a proper place for the intellect
in Christianity...

In praying and singing, both the mind and the spirit should be
fully engaged. When we sing, we should also be thinking about
the meaning ~ (message) in the words...

When we poor out our feelings to God in prayer, we should not 
turn off our capacity to think...

Let us remember ~ 'True Christianity' is neither barren intellectualism
nor thoughtless emotionalism...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for giving mean the capability to
reason. I pray that you would forgive me when my mind seems to 
wonder in the middle of a prayer. I want to be open to Your Spirit's
leading, but I also want to be focused on the needs that I want You
to address...I pray this in Jesus name...Amen.

Keep looking up, for His will to fulfill...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

except on your knees...(Jm. 5:13a)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Tongues, then, are a sign, not for believers but for unbelievers; 
Prophecy, however, is for believers, not for unbelievers...

So if the whole church comes together and everyone speaks in
tongues, and some who do not understand or some unbelievers
come in, will they not say that you are out of your mind?

But if an unbeliever or someone who does not understand comes 
in while everybody is prophesying, he will be convinced by all, that 
he is a sinner and will be judged by all,

and the secrets of the heart will be laid bare, so he will fall down and
Worship God, exclaiming, "God is really among you!" (I Cor. 14:22-25 NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

The way the Corinthians were speaking in tongues was helping 
no one because believers did not understand what was being 
said, and unbelievers thought that the people speaking in tongues
were crazy...

Speaking in tongues was supposed to be a sign to unbelievers
(as it was in Acts 2)...

After speaking in tongues believers were supposed to explain
what was said and give the credit to God. The unsaved people 
would then be convinced of a spiritual reality and motivated
to look further into the Christian faith...

While this is one way to reach unbelievers, Paul says that clear
preaching is usually better (14:5).

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that my witness would always 
be clear to the unbeliever. May my actions be a true witness
each and every day. I pray that my witness would motivate 
the unbeliever to examine Your Word more closely...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is only a prayer away...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Our Bible verses for Today:

What then shall we say, brothers? when you come together everyone
has a hymn, or a word of instruction, a revelation, a tongue or an 
interpretation. All of these must be done for the strengthening of the
church...

If anyone speaks in a tongue, two or at the most three ~ should speak,

If there is no interpreter, the speaker should keep quiet in the church

Our Lesson for Today:

Everything done in a worship service must be beneficial to the worshipers.

This principle touches every aspect ~ singing, preaching, and the exercise
of spiritual gifts.

Those who are contributing to the services, such as (singers, speakers
and readers) must have love as their chief motivation, speaking useful 
words or participating in a way that will strengthen the faith of other believers.

Dear Heavenly Father help me to always contribute to 
the worship service in such a way that it will be conducted
in an orderly manner. I know Lord that You are not a God 
of confusion, and that Your Spirit cannot work when there 
is chaos and disorder. I pray this in the Name of Jesus...Amen.

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather...

is often a good night's sleep...(Ps. 127:2)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Women should remain silent in the churches. They are not
allowed to speak, but must be in submission, as the Law says.

If they want to inquire about something, they should ask their
husbands at home; for it is disgraceful for a woman to speak
in church...(I Cor. 14:34, 35) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Does this mean that women should not speak in church services today?

It is clear from (I Cor. 11:5) that women prayed and prophesied in public worship.
It is also clear in Chapt. 12-14 that women are given spiritual gifts and are
encouraged to exercise them in the body of Christ...

Women have much to contribute and can participate in worship services...

It may have been such a thing that the women were questioning the
order of worship and cause disputes in the church that could have been 
settled at home...

The purpose for Paul's words was to promote unity, not to teach about
women's roles in the church...

Remember God is ~ a God of order...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that you would guide us
to take part in church functions in an orderly fashion.
Help us to agree to disagree in a loving manner when
we can not not come to an agreement on some subject...Amen.

Keep looking up, His will to obey...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Our Bible Verses for Today:

What I received I passed on to you as of first importance: that Christ died 
for our sins according to the Scriptures,

that He was buried, that He was raised on the third day according to the
Scriptures...(I Cor 15:3, 4) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

There will always be people who say that Jesus didn't rise from the dead.
But Paul assures us that many people saw Jesus after His resurrection:

In verse 5 and following Paul says, Peter, the disciples (the twelve) and more

deny the Resurrection. Be filled with hope because of the knowledge that
one day you and they will see the living proof when Christ returns...

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the Scriptures which
tells us the Good News that Your Son did rise from the dead
and that one day we too will be raised to new life. I pray
that Your Holy Spirit will be able to awaken the hearts of those
who do not believe...Amen.

Keep looking up, in love for He first loved you...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

03/22/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ God can help us love those who are often 
unlovable...(I Jn. 4:11)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul says, "I am the least of the apostles and do not even deserve
to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God.

But by the grace of God, I am what I am, and His grace to me was
not without effect. No I worked harder than all of them ~ yet not I, 
but the grace of God that was in me... (I Cor 15:9, 10) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

As a zealous Pharisee, Paul had been an enemy of the Christian Church,
even to the point of capturing and persecuting believers (see Acts 9:1-3).

So he felt unworthy to be called an apostle of Christ. But it goes without 
saying that He did become the most influential of the apostles...

Paul was deeply humble ~ he knew that he had worked hard and had
accomplished much but only because God had poured kindness and
grace upon him...

True humility is not convincing yourself that you are worthless but
recognizing God's work in you. It is having God's perspective on who
you are and acknowledging His grace in developing your abilities...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I do at times feel that I am not worthy,
but seeking for sensitivity and obedience to Your Holy Spirits
leading I can become what You will for me to be...Lead me
in the path of righteousness...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is the Way ~ the Truth ~ and the Life
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Paul was deeply humble ~ he knew that he had worked hard and had accomplished much but only because God had poured kindness and grace upon him. It is having God's perspective on who you are and acknowledging His grace in developing your abilities.

Lord, grant us the same spirit of humility, that we may see our abilities and accomplishments as gifts from Your hand, and use them to further Your Kingdom. May we never forget that it is Your power at work within us, and not our own. We give You all the glory. Amen.

03/24/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ We are rich according to what we are,
not according to what we have...(Pro.13:7) 

Our Bible Verses for Today:

If there is no resurrection from the dead, then not even Christ has been
raised...

And if Christ has not been raised, our preaching is useless and so is
your faith...

More than that, we are found to be false witnesses about God, for we 
have testified about God that He raised Christ from the dead. BUT He 
did not raise Him if in fact the dead are not raided...

For if the dead are not raised, than Christ has not been raised either.

And if Christ has not been raised, your faith is futile; you are still dead 
in your sins...

Then those also who have fallen asleep in Christ are lost...(I Cor. 15:13-18) NIV
(Tuesdays devotion will give you the rest of the story)

Our Lesson for Today:

The resurrection of Christ is the central thought of the gospel message,
and because Christ was raised from the dead as He promised, we know
that what He said is true ~ He is God...

Because He rose, we have the certainty that our sins are forgiven.
Because He rose, He lives and represents us to God.
Because He rose, and defeated death, we know that we will also be raised...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for all that You accomplished
on the cross in my behalf. I thank You for the forgiveness of sins.
I thank You that You are my mediator, and I thank You that one
day You will raise me from the dead to a place that You have
prepared for me in Your Kingdom...Amen.

Keep looking up, He will guide you through life...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: The resurrection of Christ is the central thought of the gospel message, and because Christ was raised from the dead as He promised, we know that what He said is true ~ He is God. Because He rose, we have the certainty that our sins are forgiven. Because He rose, He lives and represents us to God. Because He rose, and defeated death, we know that we will also be raised.
original_verse_text: If there is no resurrection from the dead, then not even Christ has been raised. And if Christ has not been raised, our preaching is useless and so is your faith. More than that, we are found to be false witnesses about God, for we have testified about God that He raised Christ from the dead. BUT He did not raise Him if in fact the dead are not raided. For if the dead are not raised, than Christ has not been raised either. And if Christ has not been raised, your faith is futile; you are still dead in your sins. Then those also who have fallen asleep in Christ are lost.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the glorious truth of Christ's resurrection, which assures us of the forgiveness of our sins and the promise of eternal life. As Your Spirit dwells within us, may we live in the power of the resurrection, confident that just as You raised Jesus from the dead, You will also give life to our mortal bodies. We rejoice in the victory over death that is ours through our risen Savior. Amen.

03/25/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Life can only be understood by looking backward,
but it must be lived by looking forward...(Lk. 9:62)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

If only for this we have hope in Christ, we are to be pitied
more than all men...

But Christ has indeed been raised from the dead, the first 
fruits of those who have fallen asleep...(I Cor. 15:19, 20 ) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Why does Paul say believers would be miserable if there were
only earthly value to Christianity?

Well we need to remember that in Paul's day Christianity brought
a person persecution, ostracism from family, and, in many cases,
poverty...

These were few tangible benefits from being a Christian in that
society. It was certainly not a step up the social or career later...

More important is the fact that if Christ had not been resurrected 
from the dead, Christian would not be forgiven of their sins or
have any hope of eternal life...

Now just as the first fruits of the harvest were brought to the
temple as an offering, so Christ was the first to rise from the 
dead and never die again...

He is our forerunner, the guarantee of our eventual resurrection
to eternal life...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You that because of Your
death and resurrection, I have the guarantee of my eventual
resurrection to eternal life with You in Your Kingdom...Amen.

Keep looking up, to Jesus, who is the Leader
and the source of our faith...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

These were few tangible benefits from being a Christian in that society. It was certainly not a step up the social or career later. More important is the fact that if Christ had not been resurrected from the dead, Christian would not be forgiven of their sins or have any hope of eternal life. Now just as the first fruits of the harvest were brought to the temple as an offering, so Christ was the first to rise from the dead and never die again. He is our forerunner, the guarantee of our eventual resurrection to eternal life.

Though we may face trials and tribulations in this world, we cling to the promise of eternal life through the resurrection of Your Son, Jesus Christ. May we hold fast to the assurance that as Christ was the first to rise, so too shall we be raised to dwell with You forever. We look forward to that glorious day with eager anticipation, trusting in Your unfailing love. Amen.

Well, we need to remember that in Paul's day, Christianity brought a person persecution, ostracism from family, and, in many cases, poverty. 03/26/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Sometime we are so busy adding up our troubles
that we forget to count our blessings...(Ps. 77:11, 12)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

For since death came through one man, the resurrection
of the dead comes also through a man...

For as in Adam all die, so in Christ all will be made alive...

Each in his own turn; Christ the firstfruits; then, when He 
comes, those who belong to Him...(I Cor. 15:21-23) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Death came into the world as a result of Adam & Eve's sin...

In Ro. 5:12-21, Paul explained why Adam's sin brought sin to 
all people, how death and sin spread to all humans because 
of his first sin and the parallel between Adam's death and 
Christ's resurrection...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, bring to the forefront of my mind my
sins today, that I may confess them to You and have them 
washed away. Lead my feet on solid ground...Amen.

Keep looking up, that you might be lead in childlike faith...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Death came into the world as a result of Adam & Eve's sin. In Romans 5:12-21, Paul explained why Adam's sin brought sin to all people, how death and sin spread to all humans because of his first sin and the parallel between Adam's death and Christ's resurrection.
original_verse_text: For since death came through one man, the resurrection of the dead comes also through a man. For as in Adam all die, so in Christ all will be made alive. Each in his own turn; Christ the firstfruits; then, when He comes, those who belong to Him.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the weight of sin that has been passed down from generation to generation. Just as Adam's disobedience brought death, we are grateful that Your Son, Jesus Christ, has conquered sin and death through His resurrection. Lord, may we find hope in the promise of new life and eternal salvation that is found in Christ alone. We thank You for Your unfailing love and the redemption that is available to all who believe. Amen.

03/27/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Falling down doesn't make you a failure,
but staying down does...(Pro. 24:16a)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

He must reign until He has put all His enemies under His feet...

The last enemy to be destroyed is death...

For He "has put everything under His feet." Now when it says
that "everything" has been put under Him, it is clear that this does
not include God Himself, who put everything under Christ...

When He has done this, then the Son Himself will be made
subject to Him who put everything under Him, So that God may
be all in all...(I Cor. 15:25-28) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Even though God the Father and God the Son are equal, each
has a special work to do and an area of sovereign control (15:28).

Christ is not inferior to the Father, but His work is to defeat all
evil on the earth. First, He defeated sin and death on the cross,
and in the end He will defeat Satan and all evil...

World events may seem to be out of control, and justice may
seem to have vanished. But God is in control, allowing evil to
remain for a time until He sends Jesus to earth again. Then 
He will present to God a perfect new world...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your perfect
plan ~ but I pray for patience while I wait for it to come
into being. Forgive me for worrying about all the sinful
worldly events, help me to put my trust in You...Amen.

Keep looking up, His timing is perfect...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Even though God the Father and God the Son are equal, each has a special work to do and an area of sovereign control (15:28). Christ is not inferior to the Father, but His work is to defeat all evil on the earth. First, He defeated sin and death on the cross, and in the end He will defeat Satan and all evil. World events may seem to be out of control, and justice may seem to have vanished. But God is in control, allowing evil to remain for a time until He sends Jesus to earth again. Then He will present to God a perfect new world.

When He has done this, then the Son Himself will be made subject to Him who put everything under Him, So that God may be all in all.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for Your sovereign control over all things. Though evil may seem to reign, we trust that Your Son, our Lord Jesus Christ, will ultimately defeat all enemies and present to You a perfect new world. Help us to remain steadfast in our faith, knowing that Your plan will be fulfilled in Your perfect timing. May Your kingdom come, and Your will be done on earth as it is in heaven. Amen.

Then He will present to God a perfect new world.

03/28/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ If a task is once begun, never leave it till it's done.
Be a labor great or small, do it well or not at all...(Jn. 17:4)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Now if there is no resurrection, what will those do who are baptized
for the dead? If the dead are not raised at all, why are people baptizing 
them?

And as for us, why do we endanger ourselves every hour?

I die every day ~ I mean that, brothers ~ just as surely as I glory over 
you in Christ Jesus our Lord...

If I fought wild beasts in Ephesus for merely human reasons, what
have I gained? If the dead are not raised, "Let us eat and drink, for
tomorrow we die,"

Do not be misled: "Bad company corrupts good character."

Come back to your senses as you ought, and stop sinning; for
there are some who are ignorant of God ~ I say this to your shame...
(I Cor. 15:29-34) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

If death ended it all, enjoying the moment would be all that mattered.
But Christians know that there is life beyond the grave and that our 
life on earth is only a preparation for our life that will never end...

What you do today matters for eternity. In light of eternity sin is a
foolish gamble...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for the Life that you have 
promised to all who believed...Help me to always remember 
to put my trust in You, each time I put my trust in myself I
become frustrated. Forgive me for attempting to fix something only You can change...Amen.

Keep looking up, God can change you for the better...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

In light of eternity sin is a foolish gamble.

Come back to your senses as you ought, and stop sinning; for there are some who are ignorant of God ~ I say this to your shame.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that our citizenship is in heaven, where our resurrected bodies will be transformed to be like Your glorious Son (Philippians 3:20-21). Help us to live with an eternal perspective, not wasting our lives in sinful pleasures, but investing in the things that matter for eternity (1 Corinthians 15:29-34). May we eagerly await the day when death is swallowed up in victory, and we are raised to new life in Your presence. Amen.

03/29/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Time is more valuable than money because
time is irreplaceable...(Eph. 5:16)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Someone may ask, "How are the dead raised? With what
kind of body will they come?"

How foolish! What you sow does not come to life unless it
dies...(I Cor. 15:35, 36) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul launches into a discussion about what our resurrection
bodies will be like. If you could select you own bodies what 
kind would you choose???

What would you choose ~~~ would it be strong - athletic or beautiful? 

Paul explains that we will be recognizable in our resurrected
body, yet it will be better than we can imagine, because it will 
be made to last for ever...

We will still have our own personality and individuality, but they 
will be perfect through Christ's work...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the promise that one 
day I will have a glorious body one that will never age, one 
that will never experience pain or suffering, yet one that will 
be recognizable to those who have gone on before...Amen.

Keep looking up, He will gently lead...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

What would you choose ~~~ would it be strong - athletic or beautiful? Paul explains that we will be recognizable in our resurrected body, yet it will be better than we can imagine, because it will be made to last for ever. We will still have our own personality and individuality, but they will be perfect through Christ's work.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we eagerly await the redemption of our bodies, the fulfillment of your promise of eternal life. Though we cannot fully comprehend the nature of our resurrected forms, we trust that they will be more glorious than we can imagine, reflecting your perfect design. Grant us patience as we endure the present sufferings, knowing that the future hope you have secured for us is worth far more than any temporary affliction. May our hearts and minds remain fixed on the eternal weight of glory that awaits. Amen.
reflection: Paul launches into a discussion about what our resurrection bodies will be like. If you could select your own bodies, what kind would you choose? What would you choose? Would it be strong, athletic, or beautiful? Paul explains that we will be recognizable in our resurrected body, yet it will be better than we can imagine, because it will be made to last forever. We will still have our own personality and individuality, but they will be perfect through Christ's work.
subject: Resurrected Bodies: What Will They be Like?

original_content:
03/31/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ The best way to forget your own problems
is to help someone solve his...(Phil. 2:4).

Our Bible Verses for Today:

The sun has one kind of glory, while the moon and stars each have
another kind. And even the stars differ from each other in their beauty
and brightness...

It is the same way of the resurrection of the dead. Our earthly bodies,
which die and decay, will be different when they are resurrected, for 
they will never die...

Our bodies now disappoint us, but when they are raised, they will be
full of glory. They are weak now, but when they are raised, they will
be full of power...

They are natural human bodies now, but when they are raised, they 
will be spiritual bodies. For just as there are natural bodies, so also
there are spiritual bodies...(I Cor. 15:41-44) NLT

Our Lesson for Today:

Our natural bodies are perishable and prone to decay.
But our resurrection bodies will be transformed...

Our spiritual bodies will not be limited by the laws of nature.
This does not necessarily mean we will be super-people,
but our body will be different from and more capable than
our present earthly body...

Our spiritual body will not be weak, we will never get sick, 
and we will never die....

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I am looking forward to the day we will
receive our spiritual bodies where there will be no more sorrows
or tears, no more pain or death. I thank You for the promise of 
a new home with You...Amen.

Keep looking up, His hand is gently knocking on your door...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

This does not necessarily mean we will be super-people, but our body will be different from and more capable than our present earthly body. Our spiritual body will not be weak, we will never get sick, and we will never die. .

Our bodies now disappoint us, but when they are raised, they will be full of glory. They are weak now, but when they are raised, they will be full of power. They are natural human bodies now, but when they are raised, they will be spiritual bodies. For just as there are natural bodies, so also there are spiritual bodies.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the promise of eternal life and the transformation that awaits us. As our earthly bodies are perishable, we look forward to the day when we will receive our spiritual bodies, no longer limited by the laws of nature. May the power of Your Spirit, who raised Jesus from the dead, dwell in us and give life to our mortal bodies. We eagerly await the day when we will be raised imperishable, no longer subject to weakness, sickness, or death. Amen.

Our spiritual body will not be weak, we will never get sick, and we will never die.

04/01/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ God can heal a broken heart but He has to
have all the pieces...(Pro. 23:26a)

Our Bible Verse for Today:

So it is written: "The first man Adam became a living being;"
the last Adam, a life giving spirit...(I Cor 12:45) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Because Christ rose from the dead, He is a life giving spirit.

This means that He entered into a new form of existence.
He is the source of the spiritual life that will result in our 
resurrection...

Christ's new glorified human body now suits His new glorified life
just as Adam's human body was suitable to his natural life.

When we are resurrected, God will give us a transformed, eternal
bodies suited to our new eternal life...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Thank You for the promise of a glorified 
body. A Body that will know no pain or sorrow. A body that will 
live with you eternally...Amen.

Keep looking up, to the King Eternal...
You are in the Prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Because Christ rose from the dead, He is a life giving spirit. This means that He entered into a new form of existence. He is the source of the spiritual life that will result in our resurrection. Christ's new glorified human body now suits His new glorified life just as Adam's human body was suitable to his natural life. When we are resurrected, God will give us a transformed, eternal bodies suited to our new eternal life.
original_verse_text: So it is written: "The first man Adam became a living being; " the last Adam, a life giving spirit.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the glorious resurrection of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Through His victory over death, He has become the life-giving spirit, the source of the spiritual life that will result in our own resurrection. Lord, as we have been united with Christ in a death like His, may we also be united with Him in a resurrection like His, that we may walk in newness of life. Grant us transformed, eternal bodies suited to our new eternal life in Your presence. Amen.
reflection: Because Christ rose from the dead, He is a life-giving spirit. This means that He entered into a new form of existence. He is the source of the spiritual life that will result in our resurrection. Christ's new glorified human body now suits His new glorified life, just as Adam's human body was suitable to his natural life. When we are resurrected, God will give us transformed, eternal bodies suited to our new eternal life.
subject: Risen Christ's Glorious New Life
verse_text: So it is written: “The first man Adam became a living being; ” the last Adam, a life giving spirit.
